1.title: Echoes of Apartheid
1.plot: Under apartheid, South Africa's police were notorious for extrajudicial killings and the routine use of torture against political dissidents. Only later did it emerge that these same techniques were being used even when the victims were suspected criminals, rather than enemies of the racist state. On the birth of the Rainbow Nation two decades ago, most people believed that this would quickly become a thing of the past, that a new era of prosperity, justice and social harmony would make such abuses unthinkable. But in the past 20 years, with both prosperity and social...

2.title: Uganda: Living in Fear
2.plot: Many Ugandans have lived through fear over the decades - either because of the actions of Joseph Kony's Lord's Resistance Army or from the campaign of an Islamist insurgency known as the ADF. But today Ugandan Muslims face a different anxiety. Over the past two years, unknown assailants have ambushed and killed a dozen of the country's leading Muslim clerics. Others survived and now live in fear. The attacks have occurred across the country, from the capital, Kampala, to border towns like Mbale. The government and police say that ADF insurgents, among others, are ...

3.title: Nigeria's Baby Farmers
3.plot: It is understandable why a desperate childless couple might do anything to have a baby, but those who exploit their unhappiness for profit are not so easy to forgive. In this deeply disturbing episode of Africa Investigates, Ghana's undercover journalist Anas Aremeyaw Anas and investigative reporter Rosemary Nwaebuni team up to identify and expose some of those those behind Nigeria's heart-breaking baby trade. It is a scam that exploits couples desperate for a baby and young pregnant single mothers - often stigmatised in a country where abortion is illegal except in ...

4.title: Mozambique's Gem Wars
4.plot: Investigating corruption and mysterious deaths at the heart of Mozambique's lucrative ruby mining industry.

5.title: Ghana: Cancer Ward
5.plot: Of all the exports from the West to the developing world, breast cancer is one of the most unpleasant. What was once described as a curse of the rich is now on the march through Africa. Journalist Chika Oduah went to Ghana to investigate.

6.title: Kenya Lighting Up
6.plot: We investigate Big Tobacco's disturbing attempts to increase the sale of cigarettes in Kenya.

0.title: Sierra Leone: Timber!
0.plot: In this edition of Africa Investigates, reporter Sorious Samura exposes the high level corruption that is stripping his homeland bare.

3.title: Zimbabwe's Child Exodus
3.plot: What motivates thousands of children to take great risks smuggling themselves across the border into South Africa?

6.title: Fools Gold
6.plot: Lifting the lid on Ghana's illusory pot of gold and exposing those duping gold speculators out of millions of dollars.

3.title: Nigeria's Fake Doctors
3.plot: Two journalists go undercover to delve into the disturbing world of West Africa's quack doctors.

4.title: Ghana: Food for Thought
4.plot: An undercover investigation into the disturbing theft and black market sale of international food aid in Ghana.

imdb.plot outline: On a continent where investigative reporters face intimidation and beatings and where death threats are an occupational hazard, African journalists go undercover to find the wrongdoers and put them under the spotlight. Africa Investigates is a groundbreaking series that exposes corruption and abuse across Africa.
imdb.title: Africa Investigates
plot: On a continent where investigative reporters face intimidation and beatings and where death threats are an occupational hazard, African journalists go undercover to find the wrongdoers and put them under the spotlight. _Africa Investigates_ (qv) is a groundbreaking series that exposes corruption and abuse across Africa.::Al Jazeera
